intro: Sonchoseris arvensis, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a radiate head, surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture with serrated edges. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
